    "the continued fraction of a real number can be generated by the gauss transformation @xmath15 defined by @xmath16 in the sense that every irrational number @xmath3 in @xmath17 can be uniquely expanded as an infinite expansion of the form @xmath18 where @xmath19 and @xmath20 for @xmath21 are called _ partial quotients _ of @xmath3 ( @xmath22 denoting the integral part of @xmath3 ) .",
    "for simplicity , we will denote the second term in ( [ ff2 ] ) by @xmath23 $ ] and the third term by @xmath24 $ ] .",
    "it was known to e. borel @xcite ( 1909 ) that for lebesgue almost all @xmath25 , there exists a subsequence @xmath26 of @xmath27 such that @xmath28 .",
    "a more explicit result due to borel - bernstein ( see @xcite ) is the @xmath29-@xmath30 law which hints that for almost all @xmath31 $ ] , @xmath32 holds for infinitely many @xmath12 s or finitely many @xmath12 s according to @xmath33 diverges or converges .",
    "then it arose a natural question to quantify the exceptional sets in terms of hausdorff dimension ( denoted by @xmath7 ) .",
    "the first published work on this aspect was due to i. jarnik @xcite ( 1928 ) who was concerned with the set @xmath34 of continued fractions with bounded partial quotients and with the sets @xmath35 , where @xmath36 is the set of continued fractions whose partial quotients do not exceed @xmath37 .",
    "he successfully got that the set @xmath34 is of full hausdorff dimension , but he did nt find the exact dimensions of @xmath35 . later , many works are done to estimate @xmath38 , including those of i. j. good @xcite , r. bumby @xcite , d. hensley @xcite , o. jenkinson and m. pollicott @xcite , r. d. mauldin , m. urbaski @xcite and references therein . up to now , the optimal approximation on @xmath38 is the result given by o. jenkinson @xcite ( 2004 ) : @xmath39 which is claimed to be accurate to 54 decimal places .    in the present paper ,",
    "we study the khintchine exponents and the lyapunov exponents of continued fractions . for any @xmath25 with its continued fraction ( [ ff2 ] )",
    ", we define its _ khintchine exponent _ @xmath2 and _ lyapunov exponent _",
    "@xmath40 respectively by @xmath41 if the limits exist .",
    "the khintchine exponent of @xmath3 stands for the average ( geometric ) growth rate of the partial quotients @xmath42 , and the lyapunov exponent which is extensively studied from dynamical system point of view , stands for the expanding rate of @xmath43 .",
    "their common feature is that both are birkhoff averages .",
    "let @xmath44 .",
    "assume that @xmath45 .",
    "the _ fast khintchine exponent _ and _ fast lyapunov exponent _ of @xmath31 $ ] , relative to @xmath13 , are respectively defined by @xmath46    it is well known ( see @xcite ) that the transformation @xmath43 is measure preserving and ergodic with respect to the gauss measure @xmath47 defined as @xmath48 an application of birkhoff ergodic theorem yields that for lebesgue almost all @xmath25 , @xmath49 here @xmath50 is called the _ khintchine constant _ and @xmath51 the _",
    "both constants are relative to the gauss measure .    for real numbers",
    "@xmath52 , we are interested in the level sets of khintchine exponents and lyapunov exponents : @xmath53 we are also interested in the level sets of fast khintchine exponents and fast lyapunov exponents : @xmath54    the _ khintchine spectrum _ and the _ lyapunov spectrum _ are the dimensional functions : @xmath55 the following two functions @xmath56 are called the _ fast khintchine spectrum _ and the _ fast lyapunov spectrum _ relative to @xmath13 .",
    "m. pollicott and h. weiss @xcite initially studied the level set of @xmath57 and obtained some partial results about the function @xmath58 . in the present work",
    ", we will give a complete study on the khintchine spectrum and the lyapunov spectrum .",
    "fast khintchine spectrum and fast lyapunov spectrum are considered here for the first time .",
    "we shall see that both functions @xmath59 and @xmath60 are equal .",
    "we start with the statement of our results on fast spectra .",

    "_ lyapunov spectrum    the last two theorems are concerned with special birkhoff spectra . in general , let @xmath119 be a dynamical system ( @xmath43 being a map from a metric space @xmath120 into itself ) .",
    "the birkhoff average of a function @xmath121 , defined by @xmath122 ( if the limit exists ) is widely studied . from the point of view of multifractal analysis ,",
    "one is often interested in determining the hausdorff dimension of the set @xmath123 for a given @xmath124 .",
    "the function @xmath125 is called the _ birkhoff spectrum _ for the function @xmath126 . when @xmath120 is compact , @xmath43 and @xmath126 are continuous , the birkhoff spectrum",
    "are well studied ( see @xcite and the references therein . see also the book of y. b. pesin  @xcite ) .",
    "the main tool of our study is the ruelle - perron - frobenius operator with potential function @xmath127 and finds @xmath128 as the solution of @xmath129 .",
    "( here @xmath69 is the pressure corresponding to the potential function of two parameters . ) by focusing on the curve @xmath128 , one can only get some partial results ( @xcite ) . in the present paper , we look for multifractal information from the whole two dimensional surface defined by the pressure @xmath69 rather than the single curve @xmath128 .",
    "this leads us to obtain complete graphs of the khintchine spectrum and lyapunov spectrum .    for the gauss dynamics , there exist several works on pressure functions associated to different potentials . for a detailed study on pressure function associated to one potential function",
    ", we refer to the works of d. mayer @xcite , and for pressure functions associated to two potential functions , we refer to the works of m. pollicott and h. weiss @xcite , of p. walters @xcite and of p. hanus , r. d. mauldin and m. urbanski @xcite .",
    "we will use the theory developed in @xcite .",
    "the paper is organized as follows . in section 2 ,",
    "we collect and establish some basic results that will be used later .",
    "section 3 is devoted to proving the results about the fast khintchine spectrum and fast lyapunov spectrum ( theorem [ thm - fast ] ) . in section 4 , we present a general ruelle operator theory developed in @xcite and then apply it to the gauss transformation . based on section 4 ,",
    "we establish theorem [ thm - birkhoff ] in section 5 .",
    "the last section is devoted to the study of lyapunov spectrum ( theorem [ thm - lyapunov ] ) .",
    "the present paper is a part of the second author s ph .",
    "d. thesis .",
    "in this section , we collect some known facts and establish some elementary properties of continued fractions that will be used later . for a wealth of classical results about continued fractions , see the books by j. cassels @xcite , g. hardy and e. wright @xcite . the books by p. billingsley @xcite , i. cornfeld , s. fomin and ya .",
    "sinai @xcite contain an excellent introduction to the dynamics of the gauss transformations and its connection with diophantine approximation .",

    "there have been various works on the ruelle transfer operator for the gauss dynamics .",
    "see d. mayer @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , o. jenkinson @xcite , o. jenkinson and m. pollicott @xcite , m. pollicott and h. weiss @xcite , p. hanus , r. d. mauldin and m. urbanski @xcite . in this section",
    "we will present a general ruelle operator theory for conformal infinite iterated function system which was developed in @xcite and then apply it to the gauss dynamics .",
    "we will also prove some properties of the pressure function in the case of gauss dynamics , which will be used later .      in this subsection",
    ", we present the conformal infinite iterated function systems which were studied by p. hanus , r. d. mauldin and m. urbanski in @xcite .",
    "see also the book of mauldin and urbanski @xcite .",
    "let @xmath408 be a non - empty compact connected subset of @xmath409 equipped with a metric @xmath410 .",
    "let @xmath411 be an index set with at least two elements and at most countable elements .",
    "an _ iterated function system _ @xmath412 is a collection of injective contractions for which there exists @xmath413 such that for each @xmath414 and all @xmath415 , @xmath416    before further discussion , we are willing to give a list of notation.@xmath417 = [ \\omega_1\\ldots \\omega_n]=   \\{x \\in i^{\\infty } : \\",
    "x_1=\\omega_1 , \\cdots , x_n=\\omega_n \\},\\\\   & & \\bullet \\ \\sigma : i^{\\infty}\\to i^{\\infty } \\ { \\rm{the\\ shift\\   transformation}},\\\\   & & \\bullet \\ \\|\\phi'_{\\omega}\\|:=\\sup_{x\\in x } |\\phi'_{\\omega}(x)| \\   { \\rm{for } } \\ \\omega\\in i^*,\\\\ & & \\bullet \\",

    "then @xmath722 and @xmath723).\\ ] ] by the gibbs property of @xmath724 , @xmath725))&\\asymp & \\exp(-np(t , q))\\prod_{j=1}^{n } \\omega_j^q(\\omega_j+\\pi(\\sigma^j \\omega))^{-2t}.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] in other words , @xmath726^{2t}.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] by lemma [ lemma2.5 ] , @xmath727 : @xmath728    it follows that latexmath:[\\ ] ] however , the hausdorff dimension of ( [ set2 ] ) is nothing but @xmath880 , the special case @xmath881 discussed in the subsection 5.1 . , which was proved to be zero .",
    "thus the proof is completed .        with the same argument",
    ", we can prove that @xmath888 is the spectrum of lyapunov exponent .",
    "it is analytic , increasing on @xmath889 $ ] and decreasing on @xmath890 .",
    "it is also neither concave nor convex . in other words ,",
    "theorem [ thm - lyapunov ] can be similarly proved .",
    "( 0,0)(10,7 ) ( 4.97,3 ) ( 8.04,2.1)@xmath88 ( 3.65,2.1)@xmath891 ( 6.3,2)@xmath118 ( 3.25,5.2)@xmath625 ( 5.0,4.2)@xmath624 ( 6.6,4.4)@xmath892 ( 8.3,5.75)@xmath622 ( 6.15,1.6)@xmath29 ( 10,1.6)@xmath551 ( 6,6.3)@xmath69      we finish the paper by the observation that the lyapunov spectrum can be stated as follows , which is similar to the classic formula , but with the difference that we have to divide the legendre transform by @xmath118 .",
    "in fact , the family of functions @xmath811 with parameter @xmath807 are just right translation of the function @xmath894 with the length @xmath807 .",
    "write the system ( [ equations - lya ] ) as follows @xmath895 if we denote by @xmath896 , the gibbs measure with respect to potential @xmath897 , then by a left translation the system ( [ equations - lya1 ] ) can be written as @xmath898 thus @xmath899 by using the second equation , we can write @xmath551 as a function of @xmath118 , hence we get ( [ t - beta ] ) .",
    "( 0,0)(10,7 ) ( 3.08,2.98 ) ( 4.71,3.16 ) ( 6.56,2.98 ) ( 4.46,1.9)@xmath891 ( 6.5,1.85)@xmath118 ( 3.05,1.85)@xmath118 ( 3.43,5)@xmath625 ( 4,6)@xmath894 ( 7,5)@xmath892 ( 8,6)@xmath900 ( 6.35,1.4)@xmath29 ( 2.05,1.75)@xmath901 ( 8.95,1.85)@xmath551 ( 6.15,6.3)@xmath902                                                                              m. pollicott and h. weiss , multifractal analysis of lyapunov exponent for continued fraction and manneville - pomeau transformations and applications to diophantine approximation , _ comm . math . phys . _ , * 207 * ( 1 ) ( 1999 ) , 145 - 171 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> assume that @xmath0 admits its continued fraction expansion @xmath1 $ ] . </S>",
    "<S> the khintchine exponent @xmath2 of @xmath3 is defined by @xmath4 when the limit exists . </S>",
    "<S> khintchine spectrum @xmath5 is fully studied , where @xmath6 and @xmath7 denotes the hausdorff dimension . in particular , we prove the remarkable fact that the khintchine spectrum @xmath8 , as function of @xmath9 , is neither concave nor convex . </S>",
    "<S> this is a new phenomenon from the usual point of view of multifractal analysis . </S>",
    "<S> fast khintchine exponents defined by @xmath10 are also studied , where @xmath11 tends to the infinity faster than @xmath12 does . under some regular conditions on @xmath13 </S>",
    "<S> , it is proved that the fast khintchine spectrum @xmath14 : \\gamma^{\\varphi}(x)= \\xi \\ } ) $ ] is a constant function . </S>",
    "<S> our method also works for other spectra like the lyapunov spectrum and the fast lyapunov spectrum . </S>"
  ]
}
